adjective.description: (of a feeling or action) experienced or done by each of two or more parties toward the other or others.
examples: a partnership based on mutual respect and understanding
my father hated him from the start and the feeling was mutual

adjective.description: Held in common by two or more parties.
examples: we were introduced by a mutual friend

origin: Late 15th century: from Old French mutuel, from Latin mutuus mutual, borrowed; related to mutare to change.
